questions.question: We reached the venue before the show .............................
Her parents .................................. with her.
questions.description: We use the simple present to talk about permanent situations.

questions.question: We ........................................ in Mumbai for fifteen years by next January.
questions.description: The future perfect and the future perfect continuous is used to say that something will have been done by a certain time in the future.

questions.question: We ..................................... two tickets before rain interrupted the match.
questions.description: The past perfect is used to talk about the earlier of the two past actions.

questions.question: I ..................................... him twice before he went abroad.
questions.description: The past perfect is used to talk about the earlier of the two past actions.

questions.question: When I was young, I .................................... exercise every day.
questions.description: We use used to to talk about past habits.

questions.question: She ...................................... for the US tonight.
questions.description: The present continuous is used to talk about pre-planned future events.

questions.question: Water .................................... at 100 degree Celsius.
questions.description: The simple present is used to talk about facts.

questions.question: We ....................................... in this house for ten years now.
questions.description: The present perfect is used to talk about actions or situations that started in the past and has continued up to the present.

questions.question: I ........................................ her if I wanted to.
questions.description: Could have + past participle can be used to talk about unrealized past events.

questions.question: Does she ................................... what she is doing?
questions.description: We use the first form of the verb (infinitive) after do, does and did.
